In Oregon , gay couples sued last year to overturn a measure passed in 2004 that amended the state constitution to exclude same - sex partners from marrying .
The measure passed eight months after local officials in Portland issued marriage licenses to 3,000 same - sex couples .
Before the constitutional amendment , state law did n't address whether gay marriage was legal .
